title: Register modal improvements
description:
We can improve the user experience with the Register modal -- and possibly improve signup conversions -- by addressing these UX issues with the production modal.

[This Figma jam board](https://www.figma.com/file/Tf7tRLoUqUWFADEsoZAaQK/Register-modal?node-id=0%3A1) highlights some of the issues visually.

1. Field validation warnings (e.g. `Must be at least 4 characters long` and `Invalid email`) change the height of the modal when they appear / disappear.

---

2. When inputting a password, the password rules overlay the fields below, including the `Confirm your password` field, making it unclear what the user should do after entering a valid password. (Note: The rules appear to disappear after the rules are successfully met.) On a mobile device, the rules are likely covered by the on screen keyboard.

---

3. On mobile devices, the `Switch to App` prompt overlays the Register modal.


### Proposed changes to registration modal

- [ ] Present `Password` and `Confirm Password` always. Currently `Confirm Password` only shows when `password` is not NULL
- [ ] Always show CAPTCHA. Currently it only shows once passwords have been entered.
- [ ] Position the captcha image and captcha input side by side as to save space vertically.
- [ ] Remove / hide the `Switch to App` prompt when modals are displayed.
- [ ] Reposition validation message to the same row as the form label, saving vertical space.
- [ ] Remove header image from modal.
- [ ] Position password rules above the input rather than below.
- [ ] Check/Update Cypress testing to account for changes.

* Large -> https://www.figma.com/file/ZzhkGGO4ZDjQQfQLGqQEJ5/Marketing-Pages-%5BWeb%5D?node-id=165%3A580
* Medium -> https://www.figma.com/file/ZzhkGGO4ZDjQQfQLGqQEJ5/Marketing-Pages-%5BWeb%5D?node-id=209%3A508
* Small -> https://www.figma.com/file/ZzhkGGO4ZDjQQfQLGqQEJ5/Marketing-Pages-%5BWeb%5D?node-id=76%3A859

title: Email: Automate bring your friends post for 7 days after registration
description:
## Summary

Send users an email one week after they sign up asking them to refer their friends.

## Conditions
- User has signed up for an account
- User has verified their email
- User has not already referred anyone
- 7 days have passed

## Subject
Friends help friends get off big tech

## Preheader
@{username}, lead the charge to join Minds.

## Copy
@{username},

We hope you've enjoyed your first week on Minds!

The best way to grow the community is by referring your friends, family, and fans. 

Not only does each referral grow your network on Minds, it also qualifies you to earn a commission on any tips and membership revenue they earn. Win, win.

[{Call to action button / "Refer Your Friends"}](https://www.minds.com/settings/other/referrals)

Thank you for being a pioneer of Internet freedom.

The Minds Team

title: Email: Automate welcome post for 1 day after registration
description:
## Summary

Send users a welcome post the day after they sign up for Minds.

## Conditions
- User has signed up for an account
- User has verified their email

## Subject
Welcome to Minds, @{username}

## Preheader
You've taken the first step. Here's what's next.

## Copy
Thanks for joining Minds! Here are a few things you can do next to establish yourself on Minds, to speak freely, earn crypto, and elevate discourse with us.

- **[Discover channels to subscribe to.](https://www.minds.com/discovery/suggestions/user)**
Minds is better with more connections. Discover interesting people and subscribe to their posts to keep your newsfeed alive.

- **[Follow the conversation.](https://www.minds.com/discovery/tags/trending)**
Check out trending topics to see what the community is talking about.

- **[Make your first post.](https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/subscriptions/latest)**
Introduce yourself with a post, and let the community know what brought you to Minds. Use the hashtag #NewFren to meet other newbies and our community welcome party.

- **[Download the app.](https://www.minds.com/mobile)**
Get notified of replies to your posts, track your crypto rewards, and post on the go with the Minds mobile app, for Android and iOS.

Welcome aboard,

The Minds Team

description:

## SEO considerations

| Tag   | Field          | Value                                                                                                                                                  |
|-------|----------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| h1    |                | Minds                                                                                                                                                  |
| h2    |                | Elevate the global conversation                                                                                                                        |
| title |                | Minds: The Alternative Social Network                                                                                                                  |
| meta  | description    | Elevate the global conversation through Internet freedom. Speak freely, protect your privacy, earn crypto, and take back control of your social media. |

## Deployment
We should launch these changes with a Growthbook experiment. As we are currently running another A-B test on the homepage for logged-out users. We will deploy these changes as a separate Growthbook experiment that runs concurrently with the other experiment.

- Classic homepage: 50%

## Acceptance

- [ ] Clicking the `Download Android App` button navigates the user to minds.com/mobile.
- [ ] Clicking the `Download iOS App` button navigates the user to the iOS App Store listing for Minds.
- [ ] The page layout responsively adapts to all common browser widths.
- [ ] The page DOM satisfies the SEO considerations described above.
- [ ] The new page is deployed as a Growthbook experiment with the distribution percentages described above.

title: Experiment: Guest Mode with Light Mode
description:
### Target problem

Our new Guest Mode homepage (Discovery feed) is not increasing new user signups.

### Hypothesis

Defaulting the Guest Mode homepage to Light Mode may improve user signup conversions.

### What is the primary metric that this change is aimed to improve?

`Has signed up` in GrowthBook.

### What is the current state of this metric, and what is the improvement goal?

- Classic homepage: 3.72%
- Guest Mode (dark mode): 3.39%

We'd like to improve Guest Mode with light mode to perform as good or better than the classic page.

### How does this change affect the desired metric?

Dark mode may not appeal to all users, who start with an assumption of light-background websites.

title: Clicking "Complete to earn tokens" checklist items doesn't work
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

The "Select tags," "Setup channel," and "Verify uniqueness" items in the "Complete to earn tokens" checklist don't respond to clicks.

![image](/uploads/046c42799d623204da2935ad9d2b3bc1/image.png)

### Steps to reproduce

- Sign up for a new account
- From the web Newsfeed, observe the "Complete to earn tokens" checklist on the right
- Click on any of these items:
  - Select tags
  - Setup channel
  - Verify uniqueness

### Platform information 

MacOS + Chrome

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

- Nothing happens; the checklist items do not respond to clicks

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- Clicking "Select tags" presents the user with a flow to select tags
- Clicking "Setup channel" presents the user with a flow to upload an avatar (and maybe other things? header image?)
- Clicking "Verify uniqueness" presents the user with a flow to verify a phone number

title: Auto-enroll users in Open Boosts
description:
Automatically opt a subset of users into viewing Open Boosts, based on their responses to the Build Your Algorithm survey.

Include all users whose responses meet ALL of these requirements:

- I prefer: Mature content > 69
- I prefer: Challenging opinions > 69
- Misinformation: Should be debated > 69

Based on an export of responses in December, this set of requirements should include about 15% of BYA respondents.

Upon completion of the BYA survey, opt user into Open Boosts if their responses match the conditions above.

For users who've previously completed the BYA survey, do a one-time batch process to opt them into Open Boosts if their responses match the conditions above.

![image](/uploads/62ef4daa887866faf7878ab0a371c951/image.png)

## Acceptance

- Given a user hasn't previously completed the Build Your Algorithm survey,
- and the user starts the BYA survey,
- and the user's responses DO meet the criteria listed above,
- when the user clicks to save their BYA settings,
- then their Settings > Boosted Content > Open Content setting is automatically set to `Enable`.
---
- Given a user hasn't previously completed the Build Your Algorithm survey,
- and the user starts the BYA survey,
- and the user's responses DO NOT meet the criteria listed above,
- when the user clicks to save their BYA settings,
- then their Settings > Boosted Content > Open Content setting is not changed from its prior setting.
---
- Given a user HAS previously completed the Build Your Algorithm survey,
- and the user's responses meet the criteria listed above,
- when when Minds runs a one-time batch process described above,
- then their Settings > Boosted Content > Open Content setting is automatically set to `Enable`.
---
- Given a user HAS previously completed the Build Your Algorithm survey,
- and the user's responses meet the criteria listed above,
- and the user has been automatically opted into Open Content: `Enable`,
- and the user navigates to the Settings > Boosted Content settings,
- when the user manually toggles the Open Content setting to `Disable`,
- and the user clicks Save Boost Settings,
- then the user's Open Content setting is kept `Disable`.

----

### Target problem

We have a persistent backlog of Open Boost orders that we're unable to fulfill. Few users opt into viewing Open Boosts, so inventory remains low.

If a Boost order gets slotted into Open and can't fulfill within a certain timeframe, the order gets cancelled and the user refunded their tokens.

### Hypothesis

We can significantly increase the number of users opted into Open Boosts if we use their Build Your Algorithm preference responses to automatically opt them into Open Boosts. By increasing the # of users opted into Open Boosts, we'll increase inventory and reduce the backlog, and in turn reducing the number of rejected Boost orders.

### What is the primary metric that this change is aimed to improve?

Open Boosts inventory

### What is the current state of this metric, and what is the improvement goal?

Unknown

### How does this change affect the desired metric?

See above.

### What counter metric will ensure that an increase in the primary metric is a positive for the product?

"Report post" events on Boosts

### Size estimate

Unknown

title: Channel pages: Implement channel recommendations component
description:
Implement the new channel recommendations component on Channel pages. See this design prototype for visual and interaction spec.

- [For channels with activity posts](https://www.figma.com/proto/c37p1Jz209IT8vRuc1AoFv/Recommendations?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=72%3A847&viewport=241%2C48%2C1&scaling=scale-down&starting-point-node-id=72%3A847&show-proto-sidebar=1)
- [For channels with empty activity feeds](https://www.figma.com/proto/c37p1Jz209IT8vRuc1AoFv/Recommendations?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=76%3A1890&viewport=241%2C48%2C1&scaling=scale-down&starting-point-node-id=76%3A1890&show-proto-sidebar=1)

## Acceptance

### Interaction: Channel has activity posts

- Given the user is viewing a Channel page,
- and the channel page DOES have activity posts in its feed,
- when the user clicks to subscribe to that channel,
- then the channel recommendations component appears at the top of the activity post feed,
- and the heading for the component reads `Consider subscribing to`,
- and the recommended channels are sourced from the logic described below.

NOTE: This is not a functional requirement where the channel feed is empty, as recommendations will be displayed by default (see below)

- [See prototype here](https://www.figma.com/proto/c37p1Jz209IT8vRuc1AoFv/Recommendations?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=72%3A847&viewport=241%2C48%2C1&scaling=scale-down&starting-point-node-id=72%3A847&show-proto-sidebar=1)


### Interaction: Channel does not have activity posts

- Given the user is viewing a Channel page,
- and the channel page DOES NOT have activity posts in its feed,
- when the page is loaded,
- then the channel recommendations component appears at the top of the activity post feed,
- and the heading for the component reads `Consider subscribing to`,
- and the recommended channels are sourced from the logic described below.

If the user were to subscribe, the recommendation slide in (described earlier) would not display.

### Which channels are recommended (logic)

- Given the channel DOES have subscriptions to other channels...
  - Include: Channels subscribed to by the channel the user is currently viewing
  - Filter out: Channels the user already subscribes to.
  - Order by: Prioritize channels by (1) mutual subscribers, (2) total subscribers, and (3) having activity on Minds within the past 7 days.
---
- Given the channel DOES NOT have subscriptions to other channels...
  - Include: Channels subscribed to by @Minds account.
  - Filter out: Channels the user already subscribes to.
  - Order by: Prioritize channels by (1) mutual subscribers, (2) total subscribers, and (3) having activity on Minds within the past 7 days.

title: Newsfeed: Implement channel recommendations component - web
description:
Implement the new channel recommendations component on the Newsfeed. See this design prototype for visual and interaction spec.


### Designs

See prototype below

- [Channel recommendations on Newsfeed](https://www.figma.com/proto/c37p1Jz209IT8vRuc1AoFv/Recommendations?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=126%3A2080&viewport=241%2C48%2C1&scaling=scale-down&starting-point-node-id=126%3A2080&show-proto-sidebar=1)

#### Design notes
* If a user subscribes to a new channel in-feed, the plus icon simply changes to a tick / done icon. See above design. It does not insert a new suggestion as it did before.
* It has been advised by @markeharding that the context will not be able for the first iteration of recommendations. This will be addressed moving forward.
* The sidebar channel recommendation widget should be removed from the newsfeed.
* Clicking 'See more' will bring the user to `/discovery/suggestions/user`
* When displaying the description, any line breaks should be removed. There should be a character limit of around 120 characters, allows two lines of text to be displayed on desktop.
* Where there is no channel description or context, the channel name and avatar should align. See the example of a channel with no description in the figma link above.

* Where a user has zero subscriptions, a single channel recommendation component should be displayed -> https://www.figma.com/proto/c37p1Jz209IT8vRuc1AoFv/Recommendations?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=129%3A2533&viewport=241%2C48%2C1&scaling=scale-down&starting-point-node-id=2%3A981&show-proto-sidebar=1

## Acceptance

### Interaction: Newsfeed has activity posts

- Given the user subscribes to channels with past activity posts,
- when the user visits the Newsfeed,
- then the Channel Recommendations component appears after the third activity post in the Newsfeed.

### Interaction: Newsfeed is empty

- Given the user subscribes to NO channels with past activity posts,
- when the user visits the Newsfeed,
- then the Channel Recommendations component appears at the top of the Newsfeed, above the Boost Rotator.

### Which channels are recommended (logic)

- Given the user DOES subscribe to other channels...
  - Include: Channels subscribed to by channels the user subscribes
  - Filter out: Channels the user already subscribes to
  - Order by: Prioritize channels by (1) mutual subscribers, (2) total subscribers, and (3) having activity on Minds within the past 7 days
---
- Given the user DOES NOT subscribe to other channels...
  - Include: Channels subscribed to by @minds account
  - Filter out: None
  - Order by: Prioritize channels by (1) mutual subscribers, (2) total subscribers, and (3) having activity on Minds within the past 7 days

----

From the original Gitlab issue, but now will be separated into another task for another time:

* ~~The same channel recommendation should only be shown once when viewing the newsfeed. If in 'impression 1', @userA is recommended, @userA will not appear in any future impression within that feed.~~
* ~~It has yet to be determined how frequently we display these impressions. It makes sense to display quite quickly towards the top of the feed, then at wider intervals moving down the feed. e.g. `5th position`, then every 20 positions thereafter. Too many impressions could be quite noisy, so best not to overload the feed. Discuss.~~

title: Update content policy to reflect current practice on token manipulation
description:
**Objective**

- The Content Policy states that token manipulation is an immediate ban offense.  However, the current practice is to reject the withdrawals.  We need to **update the content policy** to reflect this internal policy change.
- Update on the GitLab docs in addition to content-policy page.

![image](/uploads/d98a0112f3d5d2f8a58ffe9dd419afd0/image.png)

** Proposed Solution **

![image](/uploads/8ea4e23390a1bacf7d63f118f80cfdd1/image.png)

title: Latest / Top feed: Feed composition spec
description:
- [ ] Users can toggle between 2 separate views of their Newsfeed:
  - Latest
    - Boost rotator
    - 3x Latest posts
    - 3x Top posts + See more link
    - Latest feed (infinite scroll)
  - Top
    - Boost rotator
    - Top feed (infinite scroll)
- [ ] Default users to "Latest" view
- [ ] If user manually toggles to a one view of the Newsfeed, remember that state and return users to that view on subsequent visits to the Newsfeed.

### Designs

https://www.figma.com/proto/hJWtzurKSdqE1LeznT487N/Newsfeed-%5BWeb%5D?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=3%3A3333&viewport=241%2C48%2C0.5&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=3%3A3333

Updated designs above.

Design Notes:

* Boost rotator present for both top and latest feeds. Always number 1 position. This will be addressed in a future issue.
* A highlights section (top 3 top posts) will appear in feed, just after the third post, or fourth post if you include the boost rotator.

![image](/uploads/5e0ad5dc919b43e61d2dbfc2f2da978b/image.png)

----

Background:

### Target problem

The changes to the Newsfeed are targeted at all users and aimed to improve the relevance of the first posts the user sees when visiting the Newsfeed.

### Hypothesis

By prioritizing "Top" posts for all users, we can improve relevance of the first-seen posts on the Newsfeed. However, Minds users greatly value their traditional chronological "Latest" feeds. So we want to introduce a new default view of the Newsfeed that combines elements of "Top" with the traditional "Latest" feed.

We're mindful of potential backlash from a subset of Minds users who don't want the "Top" posts summary, so we'll offer them the option to view their old feed. For users who prefer the "Top" sorting, we'll give them the option to see a Newsfeed completely organized by "Top," not just the condensed view of the default Newsfeed.

### What is the primary metric that this change is aimed to improve?

- Engagement on the Newsfeed (likes, comments)
- Duration of sessions on the Newsfeed

### What is the current state of this metric, and what is the improvement goal?

Unknown

### How does this change affect the desired metric?

With the new "Top" widget in the default Newsfeed view, we ensure that users see (a) content that they haven't seen before, and (b) content that is most likely to be engaging.

### What counter metric will ensure that an increase in the primary metric is a positive for the product?

We should measure the % of users who set a preference for the "Latest"-only feed, as a measure of dissatisfaction with the new feature.

### Size estimate

Unknown

### WIP Prototype

https://www.figma.com/proto/hJWtzurKSdqE1LeznT487N/Newsfeed-%5BWeb%5D?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=3%3A3333&viewport=241%2C48%2C0.5&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=3%3A3333

title: Refactor experiments to use events instead of contexts
description:
## The Problem

Currently all users are bucketed into experiments on app initialisation and not when they actually see the experiment. This was done so that pageviews could register the experiments as contexts when someone lands on the site. 

Issues arise when experiment reports rely on only including users who have seen the experiment to be included. For example, an experiment that forwards users to discovery instead of the newsfeed after registration should not just only include users that have just signed up, it should also only apply to users that do not have any referral logic (ie. take newly loggedin/registered users back to previous page). 

## Proposed change

- [x] Create a new iglu schema `growthbook_event` which includes the experiment_id that the user is in
- [x] Remove backend registration and client on init logic
- [x] Record a `growthbook_event` via snowplow when an experiment is run
- [x] To avoid unnecessary events, cache a reference to the events so that they only get sent every 24 hours.
- [x] Now that we support psuedo_id, attach both the anonymous_id and user_id to growthbook events

title: Expose bot accuracy scores on front end for admins
description:
In order to (a) help with making admin decisions, and (b) QA check the scores so that admins can see what Tasman is spitting out and provide feedback on the effectiveness of the current scoring, we'd like to make Tasman-derived trust scores visible on the front end of Minds website for users with Admin access.

https://www.figma.com/file/0udJVSZSxc2Ng1Knbn20uk/Channel-Trust?node-id=2%3A2

> Designs are in progress

- Given Tasman trust scores for users are available,
- and UserA is logged into Minds,
- and UserA's account has Admin access,
- when any user avatar + name component is displayed,
- then a number is displayed alongside the avatar + name that exposes the Tasman trust score for that user.

Proposed approach for displaying the correct colour based on a 0-100 value -> https://jsfiddle.net/JeancarloFontalvo/1sco9Lpe/3/

### Notes

* Uniquely an admin feature for the first iteration
* In the future this will be visible to all users, including an explainer (via a modal) about the score, why scores are valuable and how to improve scores.

title: Posts repeat in Groups feed
description:
We have a few reports of posts repeating in groups. [This Gitlab issue](https://gitlab.com/minds/front/-/issues/5172) makes reference to the issue in a test Group. Additionally, a user alerted me that [this Group](https://www.minds.com/groups/profile/569272650258460672/feed) exhibits the issue, though notably the posts repeat only after scrolling VERY deep into the timeline (~100+ posts). The pinned comment re-appears in the feed, after which the feed appears to loop.

Note timestamps on the posts in this sequence:

![image](/uploads/8506d9700a1c3946be4513c2542eb9fd/image.png)

![image](/uploads/ea47212d127ef59d3848a0b5f5cf30fb/image.png)

![image](/uploads/4a7b2fd4af32d5038aa0dd314e204527/image.png)


### Replication steps

Effect can be seen here:

https://www.minds.com/groups/profile/1325523578161991683/feed

To replicate a base-case:

1. Make a new group
2. Make a post titled 1, and a post titled 2
3. Refresh

title: Hide Boosts for new users
description:
In order to improve the onboarding experience for new users, and to increase short-term retention, we believe we should hide / remove Boosts from feeds for new accounts.

- Given UserA's account is less than 7 days old,
- when UserA views any feed,
- then Boosts are not displayed.

- [x] A/B test

title: Show posts from subscribed Groups in Newsfeed
description:
Users like Groups because they help keep up with specific interests, but report that it's difficult to actually keep up with them because the posts in Groups are not obvious from the Newsfeed.

So we'd like to experiment by including new posts from subscribed Groups in the user's Newsfeed.

- Given UserA is a member of GroupX,
- and there are new posts made inside GroupX,
- when UserA views their Newsfeed,
- those posts from GroupX are included in the chronological Newsfeed sorted along with posts from subscribed channels,
- and the posts indicate that they are from GroupX.

![image](/uploads/b9a0d72b179fb86b74337554573f10bb/image.png)

(Example post from a group with the `(Meme Supreme)` label indicating its source.)

title: Experiment: Newly-registered users land on /discovery/top
description:
When a user completes a new registration on the web app, the user is landed on the newsfeed.

Hypothesis: 2-hour retention will improve if we instead land users on /discovery/top feed, where new users can explore content on Minds, and continue with engagements they may have attempted on the guest mode home page.

- [ ] Remove a/b test of discovery-homepage
- [ ] 50% to newsfeed, 50% to  /discovery/top

title: Guest Mode: Add composer to feed
description:
In order to better communicate what Minds is about, we'd like to add the composer component to the Guest Mode homepage feed.

- Composer appears at the top of the feed, where it would appear for a logged-in user.
- If the user clicks to type into the composer, the user is prompted to register.

Given I'm viewing a post,

### Platform information 

Reproduced in both web (desktop, mobile) as well as iOS app.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

- level 1 replies appear in descending chronological order (newest to oldest).

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- level 1 replies appear in ascending chronological order (oldest to newest)

title: Define email strategy
Boost recommendation: Test #2
description:
We previously executed [this A-B test](https://gitlab.com/minds/front/-/issues/3768) with a "Boost recommendation" visual cue aimed to increase the rate of new posts : boosts.

We want to try this test again, with a tweak on the execution aimed to improve the result.

![image](/uploads/18645951e4fc1dd66747487a78237c0f/image.png)

Previous test behavior was described as:

* given that I'm posting for the first time, I should see a tooltip that prompts me to boost a post.
  * the tooltip should be positioned above the boost button
  * it should be blue
  * it should stay for 6 seconds
  * it should not be dismissable
* given that I've already seen the tooltip once, I should see the boost button on the post shimmer after I submitted the post.
  * the shimmer should last for 12 seconds or 3 flashes

----

Let's test with this behavior instead:

* given that I'm **posting for the first time in 72 hours**, I should see a tooltip that prompts me to boost a post.
  * the tooltip should be positioned above the boost button
  * it should be blue
  * it should stay for 6 seconds
  * it should not be dismissable
* given that **I've already seen the tooltip once in the past 72 hours**, I should see the boost button on the post shimmer after I submitted the post.
  * the shimmer should last for 12 seconds or 3 flashes

title: Change copy on Twitter Sync settings page
description:
In order to better set expectations for Minds users who enable Twitter Sync, we should change the copy on the [Twitter Sync settings page](https://www.minds.com/settings/other/twitter-sync) to communicate that (1) if a tweet is deleted on Twitter, it is not automatically deleted on Minds, and (2) users can edit and/or delete posts on Minds.

Old:

> Using our Twitter Sync tool, you can have your new tweets automatically copied over from Twitter to Minds. Retweets & Replies will not be copied over.

New:

> Using our Twitter Sync tool, Twitter users with over {{followerCountVar}} followers can have their new tweets automatically copied over from Twitter to Minds. Retweets, replies, and tweet deletions are not synced to Minds. You can edit and/or delete posts on Minds through the Minds app or website.

title: Add definition for each report reason
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Defintion of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->

To add definitions for each report reason so that users report under the correct category.

...

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

We should include a small box to the left of the submit button that provides a brief definition of each report reason. The Minds Report UX is most similar to Reddit, compared to other platforms:

![image](/uploads/8e1b62479082747d22103ccb7c1588ad/image.png)

## Text for Each Reason
		
| Category                            | Subcategory             | Description                                                                                               |
|-------------------------------------|-------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Illegal                             | Terrorism               | Advertizing or recruiting for terrorist organizations                                                     |
|                                     | Sexualization of minors | Implies or promotes child sexual activity or shows genitalia                                              |
|                                     | Extortion               | Material that aims to achieve a benefit through coercion                                                  |
|                                     | Fraud                   | Intent to deceive someone for monetary or personal gain                                                   |
|                                     | Revenge porn            | Distribution of pornographic materials without consent                                                    |
|                                     | Trafficking              | Illegal sales of sex or paraphernalia (e.g. escort services, drugs)                                       |
| NSFW                                | Nudity                  | Exposure of genitalia or breasts                                                                          |
|                                     | Pornography             | Printed or visual material of explicit sexual activity                                                    |
|                                     | Profanity               | Obscene language or sensational content                                                                   |
|                                     | Violence and Gore       | Vivid, brutal, and realistic acts of violence                                                             |
|                                     | Race, Religion, Gender  | Extreme content relating to race, religion, or gender                                                     |
| Incitement to violence              |                         | Calls to violence that are imminent                                                                       |
| Harassment                          |                         | Intentionally targeting someone with the intent to torment or terrorize them                              |
| Personal or confidental information |                         | Sharing or threatening to share private, personal, or confidential information about someone             |
| Impersonation                       |                         | Assuming a false or fictitious identity, except for parody                                                |
| Spam                                |                         | Repeated, unwanted, or unsolicited manual or automated actions that negatively affect the Minds community |
| Intelectual Property Violation      |                         | Content posted to Minds that infringes a copyright you own or control                                     |
| Malware                             |                         | Code delivered over the network for the purpose of an attack                                              |
| Inauthentic Engagement              |                         | Activity that seeks to artificially inflate activity on the site to increase interaction metrics          |
| Security                            | Hacked Account          | If an account has been compromised by an unauthorized person or entity                                    |
...

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->

...

## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

![image](/uploads/5d26517f679b50504457d4972ff100c8/image.png)

![image](/uploads/2c33b86201614b74077f8b917f43de6b/image.png)

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why
--->

...

## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->

...

## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] Given the user is viewing the report modal, when the user clicks a report category, then a paragraph is inserted onto the modal that explains the selected category.
- [ ] When the user de-selects a category, then the paragraph explanation is removed from the modal.

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: 401 / 404 channel pages are crawled by Google / Google reports as errors
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Channel pages that we've intentionally set to return 401 and 404 status codes are appearing in our sitemaps, and are indexable by Google. Google has crawled these pages and reports them as errors in Search Console.

### Steps to reproduce

Google Search Console reports errors for ~7,500 minds.com URLs, reporting these URLs return a 401 error code.

Examples (401'd to avoid spam risk):

- https://www.minds.com/AllThingsStarWars/
- https://www.minds.com/mOnK-FiSh/
- More here: https://search.google.com/search-console/index?resource_id=sc-domain:minds.com

Example (404'd because account deleted):
- https://www.minds.com/MiaPetals/

Cross-reference with our sitemaps to see the URLs appear:

- https://www.minds.com/sitemaps/sitemap2.xml
- https://www.minds.com/sitemaps/sitemap3.xml

View the page source to observe the `robots` tag is set to `all`.

`<meta name="robots" content="all">`

### Platform information 

(Browser, device, system stats, screen size)

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

- We submit these URLs to Google via sitemaps, and robots allows Google to crawl the URLs

### Possible fixes

I assume two possible directions to solve for Search Console reporting the error. 

1. Remove these URLs from our sitemaps
2. Set `robots` tag to `noindex` on these pages

description:
## Goal 

Grow the number of new users by encouraging current users to invite their contacts with competitive incentives. Make the referrals OBVIOUS to users. Currently it is buried in Settings. 

## Current console

https://www.minds.com/settings/other/referrals

![Screen_Shot_2022-09-06_at_5.43.16_PM](/uploads/1fcd0814fbc74872a958ef7ee9d25b58/Screen_Shot_2022-09-06_at_5.43.16_PM.png)

## UX Design

- [Audit and inspo](https://www.figma.com/file/NfZCO1DzPnw4YTzVKOu8O7/Referrals?node-id=0%3A1)
- [Low-fi Referral Mockups](https://www.figma.com/file/NfZCO1DzPnw4YTzVKOu8O7/Referrals?node-id=95%3A3060)- playing around with ideas for referral flows and referral incentives


## Requirements 

- [x] Audit web referral flow/console
- [x] Audit mobile referral flow/console
- [x] Audit rewards associated with referrals
- [x] Introduce ability to invite people via email/twitter directly from referral console
- [x] Feature referrals in UI

title: Duplicated translation efforts (POEditor.com, CrowdIn.com)
description:
### Summary

There are duplicated translation efforts: POEditor.com and CrowdIn.com!

### Steps to reproduce

As it seems there are two places to translate Minds GUI/API and they are independent. In my Language Hungarian, POeditor seems to be in work for years, but far from complete and low quality. In CrowdIn I made it from scratch to 100%, high quality.

This divides efforts and I guess only one of them will be included in Minds source code!

### Platform information 

CrowdIn, POEditor 

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

"developers.minds.com" sends users to POEditor 

"Settings" on Minds.com sends users to CrowdIn 

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Kill POEditor and remove links from Developers.minds.com. And merge completed languages from CrowdIn please!

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![minds_poeditor](/uploads/d143254f1ee3f0cd1ab4e46ff2f2c63c/minds_poeditor.png)

title: About Us Page
description:
### Summary

The website doesn't seem to have an "about us" page. Currently, the closest thing to an "about us" page is the Whitepaper. This content is certainly relevant, but since it's a PDF it will not have the best opportunity to rank, and in this particular case, the search engine isn't even indexing the Mind's Whitepaper. Is there any data on the current engagement for this page on analytics? 

Also, from a user experience standpoint, the content of the Whitepaper is long and most users won't consider reading through it. Creating a concise “about us” landing page that can be crawled and indexed on search engines will drive traffic to Mind's website and also give people a simple way to learn about Minds before they sign up. 

----

As Guest mode will replace the current logged-out Minds.com homepage contents with preview newsfeed, and we want to keep the contents of the current page available, we should relocate the page to minds.com/about URL.

----

minds.com/p/about

title: Minds installation fails at ElasticSearch 6.x+ step
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Minds local stack installation times out using Windows' WSL 2

### Steps to reproduce

- Join Windows Insider and enable WSL 2
- Install Docker for Windows with WSL 2 support
- Try to install the stack with `minds install`
- ElasticSearch 6.x+ step times out and fails

### Platform information 

Windows 10 Pro with Ubuntu 18 LTS running on WSL 2 mode

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Local stack installation fail at ElasticSearch provision step due to vm.max_map_count being too low for ES.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Local stack installation to succeed.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

```
Pulling elasticsearch (elasticsearch:6.6.2)...
Creating minds_elasticsearch_1 ... done
Operation timed out
6.6.2: Pulling from library/elasticsearch
Digest: sha256:59dd45d05fe89cd713dfc20874c6298e1ec7eaf384e58410b677b9dead6986f1
Status: Downloaded newer image for elasticsearch:6.6.2
Provisioning elastic search
Waiting for elastic search to come online...
    at makeError (D:\Minds\minds\local\node_modules\execa\lib\error.js:58:11)
    at handlePromise (D:\Minds\minds\local\node_modules\execa\index.js:114:26)
    at runMicrotasks (<anonymous>)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:97:5) {
  shortMessage: 'Command failed with exit code 1: docker-compose -f docker-compose.yml -f docker-compose.with-phpspec.yml run elasticsearch-provisioner',
  command: 'docker-compose -f docker-compose.yml -f docker-compose.with-phpspec.yml run elasticsearch-provisioner',
  exitCode: 1,
  signal: undefined,
  signalDescription: undefined,
  stdout: '6.6.2: Pulling from library/elasticsearch\r\n' +
    'Digest: sha256:59dd45d05fe89cd713dfc20874c6298e1ec7eaf384e58410b677b9dead6986f1\r\n' +
    'Status: Downloaded newer image for elasticsearch:6.6.2\r\n' +
    'Provisioning elastic search\n' +
    'Waiting for elastic search to come online...',
  stderr: 'Pulling elasticsearch (elasticsearch:6.6.2)...\r\n' +
    'Creating minds_elasticsearch_1 ... \r\r\n' +
    '\u001b[1A\u001b[2K\rCreating minds_elasticsearch_1 ... \u001b[32mdone\u001b[0m\r\u001b[1BOperation timed out',
  failed: true,
  timedOut: false,
  isCanceled: false,
  killed: false,
  context: [Object: null prototype] {}
}
```

### Possible fixes

We need to detect if we're on a Linux environment (either standalone or via WSL 2) scenarios and ask the user to set vm. max_map_count=262144 in their sysctl.
